place_description: Agartala is the capital city of Tripura, a northeast Indian state. The huge, white Ujjayanta Palace, built in 1901 by Maharaja Radha Kishore Manikya, has Mughal-style gardens with fountains. It houses the Tripura Government Museum, where displays include 9th-century sculptures. Nearby, ornate columns and pointed domes mark the Hindu temple Jagannath Bari. North, Rabindra Kanan park has flowerbeds and a puppet house.

top_attractions.detail_description: Nestled in the picturesque northeastern region of India, Agartala serves as the vibrant capital of Tripura. The Agartala Railway Station stands out as a vital hub for travelers, linking this charming city to various parts of the country. With three platforms and essential amenities like ticket counters, waiting areas, and restrooms, it ensures a comfortable experience for passengers. The station is designed with accessibility in mind, featuring wheelchair access and escalators to assist those with mobility challenges.
top_attractions.excerpt: Nestled in the picturesque northeastern region of India, Agartala serves as the vibrant capital of Tripura. The Agartala Railway Station stands out as a vital hub for travelers, linking this charming
top_attractions.name: Agartala Railway Station

reviews.text:
Most of the travelers here come for NIT related purposes.
It is a modest station with 4 platforms.
The place was quite neat but the infrastructure needs an upgrade

Agartala railway station is the biggest railway station of Tripura. In the beginning there were less trains but now there are many trains which connects major Indian cities. The station is clean and looks more beautiful after dark. Patrolling of police and security personal also can be seen as there are regular issues with illegal migrants. Communication also easy as there are local rides and cab services available for all 24hrs. The area is quite big i hope in future there would be more development can be seen.

Majestic view from outside station. But when u step inside station it's very crowded no proper security checks and condition of stepstairs is very poor escalators some works some won't and lift is out of service a long ago. I'll rate it 5.5/10

Agartala is the capital of Tripura yet authorities are sleeping tight and avoiding the matter of upgradation of station

curation.llm_reason: Agartala Railway Station is a functional transport hub without unique cultural or tourist appeal.

top_attractions.detail_description:
Nestled in the heart of Agartala, the Tripura State Museum stands as a magnificent white palace that showcases the rich heritage and culture of Tripura. This museum is an essential stop for anyone looking to delve into the state's history, featuring galleries filled with fascinating exhibits that highlight both tribal culture and historical artifacts. The museum complements other regal sites like Ujjayanta Palace and Neermahal, making Agartala a treasure trove of royal splendor.

This massive white palace features galleries with exhibits on the state of Tripura.
top_attractions.excerpt: Nestled in the heart of Agartala, the Tripura State Museum stands as a magnificent white palace that showcases the rich heritage and culture of Tripura. This museum is an essential stop for anyone loo
top_attractions.name: Tripura State Museum

reviews.text: Beautiful ambience, nice collection and very informative all in one place. Must visit once. It is open at 10:15 am but staff comes late so may have to wait for some time. It closes sharp at 5:00 pm in the evening. So keep track of timings.

Tripura State Museum, in the historic Ujjayanta‚ÄØPalace, displays the cultural heritage, tribal artifacts, sculptures, coins and textiles of Tripura and Northeast India . It's open roughly 10:15‚ÄØAM to 5:00‚ÄØPM, with staff reportedly arriving slightly later, and closing promptly at 5‚ÄØPM . Entry fee for Indian visitors is ‚Çπ50, with higher charges for foreigners or Bangladeshi nationals . Light & Sound Show begins around 6:30‚ÄØPM, tickets ‚Çπ100 (adult) / ‚Çπ50 (minor); Laser Show, similar pricing-‚Çπ100 (adult)/‚Çπ50 (minor) .

The Tripura State Museum, located within the Ujjayanta Palace, is a treasure trove of the region's rich cultural heritage. Its exhibits showcase everything from tribal traditions to ancient artifacts, offering a deep dive into Tripura's history. The museum is well-organized and provides an educational experience for visitors of all backgrounds. Exploring it is a perfect way to appreciate the diverse history and culture of this fascinating state.

top_attractions.g_description: This massive white palace features galleries with exhibits on the state of Tripura.
top_attractions.address: R7PM+W39, Lakshmi Narayan Bari Rd, Palace Compound, Indranagar, Agartala, Tripura 799001, India

curation.llm_reason: Key cultural and historical museum in Agartala showcasing Tripura's heritage, popular among visitors.

top_attractions.detail_description: Oxygen Park in Agartala is a delightful green oasis nestled within the bustling city, perfect for those seeking a breath of fresh air. Accessible via auto-rickshaw or rideshare services, this park welcomes visitors with an affordable entry fee of just Rs. 10. Once inside, you'll find yourself surrounded by lush greenery and vibrant flowers that create a serene atmosphere ideal for relaxation and rejuvenation.
top_attractions.excerpt: Oxygen Park in Agartala is a delightful green oasis nestled within the bustling city, perfect for those seeking a breath of fresh air. Accessible via auto-rickshaw or rideshare services, this park wel
top_attractions.name: Oxygen Park

reviews.text:
O2 Park. From Agartala Railway station take auto direct to O2 Park. Uber & Rapido is also available. Rs. 10 /- is entry fee for adult & many more types of fees for digital camera. Free drinking water is available inside. A round walking path of 2000 m outer circle is there . At every 200 m achivement milestones are there. Branch passages are there inside the forest. Seating arrangements & dustbin are placed in close intervals. So, properly maintained and planned forest. An open gym is there. Nursery of orchid, fern and many more. Small birds collection, Rabbits are there. You can find various birds , squirrel üêøÔ∏è in the woods. Just go inside the jungle and seat for a while, but one problem is there, mosquito. You can't ignore them. Many couples find themselves good inside the forest, so, some times it may be difficult to find any vacant seat. However you can have a good walking exercise of 2 km enjoying the forest. Have some exercise in the open gym. For returning to the Agartala station, many auto and other transportation options are there. Gate closing time 18:00 hrs .
Overall my experience was very good. Really it is like the lap of mother nature. Must visit site.
Must recommended. üëç

Oxygen Park near Agartala is a green oasis that offers a refreshing escape from the city's chaos. Spread over a considerable area, this park is well-maintained with lush greenery, walking paths and plenty of seating areas for visitors to relax and enjoy nature. Some animals statues are kept in the jungle which look like real animals from a distance.
It's an ideal spot for morning walks, jogging or simply sitting back and enjoying the calm ambiance filled with rustling of wind and chirping of birds. The presence of children's play areas makes it a family-friendly destination where kids can enjoy outdoor activities.
The park is also equipped with basic amenities like restrooms and drinking water facilities, adding to the convenience for visitors.
There is a small aviary with beautiful exotic birds.
The entry fee is ten rupees per adult person and fifty rupees for a camera.

A good place to hangout in the forest area. Well maintained by the authority.
Nothing too much to see just a narrow road in the middle of the forest and one or two bird houses in which there are some collections of birds and rabbit üê¶

curation.llm_reason: Oxygen Park is a popular green space in Agartala offering a refreshing environment and affordable access, making it a well-liked local attraction.

top_attractions.detail_description: The Agartala-based heritage park showcases the history, culture, and natural beauty of Tripura in a miniature format. Visitors can explore replicas of important rivers, mountains, bridges, railways, and tourist spots from the entire state. This innovative initiative is being meticulously constructed and maintained with utmost care to ensure cleanliness throughout the park's premises. For those seeking solace away from city crowds, Heritage Park offers a serene environment filled with lush greenery and picturesque locations that provide tranquility for the mind.

top_attractions.name: Heritage Park

reviews.text: It is one of the best walking trail park of Agartala. You can easily roam around the park for morning and evening walk. Another thing you find is the miniatures of all the tourist places and its nearest station in Tripura. It has open air ampetheater also. Must visit in Agartala.

A well-maintained and peaceful place for a short visit. The key attraction is the miniature models of major tourist destinations of Tripura, which are nicely presented and informative. It offers a good overview of the state's rich heritage and landmarks in a compact space. Overall, a clean and well-organized park, suitable for a relaxed walk or family outing.
You will find beautiful miniatures of all visiting sites or buildings in Agartala Tripura. Have a morning walk here under greenery and enjoy a lot of Liche trees.

top_attractions.address: V74M+JX7, Gorkhabasti, Kunjaban, Agartala, Tripura 799006, India

curation.llm_reason: Heritage Park uniquely showcases Tripura's culture and geography in Agartala, attracting many visitors and offering educational value.

top_attractions.detail_description: Nehru Park in Agartala is a beautiful park located about 500 meters from the heritage park. Managed by women, it offers a well-maintained kids section and lush greenery. However, some visitors feel that the park closes too early at 4 pm and could benefit from extended hours. Despite this, it's praised for its cleanliness, security, and vibrant flowers.

top_attractions.name: Nehru Park

reviews.text: Very beautiful park for evening walk. This place is very close to polo central mall. This park is maintained by the science department of Tripura so you can see various flora and fauna here must visit place in Agartala and especially in the early evening.

Location is good. Public transportation is available. Entry fee is twenty only. The park may be primarily designed for children, but with time it becomes the most popular lover's park in the city. Sometimes inappropriate behaviour of couples really makes other visitors uncomfortable to roam around. The park is neat and clean, and you can spend some quality time with your friends, family, and loved ones. The park is large enough to roam and click pictures, but there is nothing special to watch. Upstairs there is a playground, park, slipper, swings, and seesaw for kids. Avoid visiting after evening.

Generally very clean, entry fee is is only Rs. 10. At the time of evening the park looks stunning and best place to hang out with friends. If you are alone and not feeling good, have a visit, the beauty will cheer you up. Only one problem is there, after rain the mosquitos attack with full strength, so don't forget to keem an odomos with you üòâ

curation.llm_reason: A pleasant, well-maintained park popular with locals but lacks unique features or cultural significance to be a major attraction in Agartala.

top_attractions.detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Agartala, Tripura, The Fern restaurant is a culinary gem that offers an eclectic mix of cuisines. From delectable North Indian dishes like Aloo Paratha and Chicken Biryani to flavorful Chinese options such as Paneer Hakka Noodles and Chilli Chicken Dry, there's something for everyone. The ambiance is inviting, featuring unique seating arrangements that blend traditional floor seating with comfortable table chairs made from bamboo.

top_attractions.name: The Fern

reviews.text: The food is amazing. There are two seating options, one on the ground floor and one on the first floor (low seating) , which is cosier. The ambience is vibrant. The staff is friendly, though service may be slow when there's a rush. So it's advisable to take some time to relax, unwind and enjoy the experience.

Visited twice and ordered for home delivery once, the most special thing about this place is the Japanese style of sitting unlike any restaurant in agartala, the atmosphere is pleasing and so is the decoration. A tribal restaurant with variety of tasty food to offer, do visit 'Fern' ü§ç

The seating arrangement made the place a unique one. After entering there is a small place with table chairs made of bamboo. From there if you go to the up floor there the seating arrangement is different you have to seat on the floor. So if you have a problem seating on the floor you can take the ground floor. The food was overall good, delicious, pricing was affordable, the quantity was also perfect üíØ One thing I didn't like is the cleanliness of the place for which I couldn't give them 5 üåü They have to regularly clean the place, especially the corner of the table it would make anyone feel uncomfortable. Secondly, there was a card saying beer anytime, anywhere and when we ask them for one they said they don't have üòÇ than why put the card on each table saying that quote üôÇ Overall a good place not much photogenic, good environment, have AC for summer days. I would recommend them üëçüèº

top_attractions.address: Happy Vly Rd, Banamalipur, Indranagar, Agartala, Tripura 799006, India

curation.llm_reason: The Fern is a well-rated local restaurant but lacks world fame, unique cultural significance, or city-defining status in Agartala's tourism landscape.

top_attractions.detail_description: Maharaja Bir Bikram Airport, also known as Agartala Airport, is the largest airport in Tripura, India. Situated in Singarbil, it offers facilities such as duty-free shops, car rentals, ATMs and currency exchange services. The airport serves airlines like Air India Regional, GoAir, IndiGo and SpiceJet. While there are no restaurants inside the airport itself, there are plenty of dining options nearby.
top_attractions.excerpt: Maharaja Bir Bikram Airport, also known as Agartala Airport, is the largest airport in Tripura, India. Situated in Singarbil, it offers facilities such as duty-free shops, car rentals, ATMs and curren
top_attractions.name: Maharaja Bir Bikram Airport, Agartala

reviews.text:
Maharaja Bir Bikram Airport is a beautiful and clean ,ü•∞facility, offering a comfortable travel experience for all passengers. Inside the airport, you can find various food üåØüåÆüå≠ options and enjoy a glimpse of traditional culture through its decor.

The airport also features unique bed-like chairs üí∫, allowing passengers to take a quick rest during layovers. The washrooms and toilets üöΩüöªare exceptionally neat and well-maintained, ensuring a pleasant experience. Located near the Bangladesh üáßüá©border, this airport serves as an important gateway for both domestic and international travel.

Very good and clean airport with seamless entry. As it is small airport than any big airport. You can also find restaurant section here and some brand outlet is also there. It is the only airport in whole Tripura. You can find direct flight from Kolkata, guwahati etc. International flight is also departed from here so you can also find immigration counter. There are 6 to 7 gates are present here for boarding.

Small Airport serving as the major aviation hub for the state of Tripura. Located at the northern suburbs of Agartala, this airport is very close to the International border. Thus, the security is very tight.
Despite of that, since it's a small airport, it takes less than 10-20 minutes to transit from the main gate to the waiting all.
Limited food and duty free outlets, there is a single lounge there in the terminal. Flight options are also very limited. Mostly Indigo operates from here.
For transportation, you can avail pre paid taxi or get a auto.

Overall, it's a comfy airport. Clean, well maintained, helping staff.

curation.llm_reason: An airport serves as a transportation hub but lacks cultural or tourist appeal as an attraction in Agartala.

top_attractions.detail_description: Rajbari Lake Garden is a recently renovated attraction in Agartala, Tripura. It's perfect for evening strolls, casual gatherings, and enjoying the refreshing air. The area offers stunning scenery that becomes even more enchanting after dark. Visitors praise its natural beauty and describe it as a place where you can truly feel nature's embrace. Located north of Jagannath Bari Mandir, it's considered one of the best spots in Agartala for relaxation and rejuvenation.

reviews.text: Recently this area has been renovated and opened for public. Its a good place for evening walks, friendly gatherings, quality time and some refreshing air. This area is so good, the vibe here will not let you go. The beautiful scenery gets even more beautiful after it gets dark. The beautiful scenery of rajbari makes it even more enjoyable.
Nice place to relax. Opposite to Jagannatha Bari. Evening light show of palace we can see it from here. We took bath here morning. We can swim here. Good place for walking
It's a good place to sit, relax enjoying the cool breeze of nature , would enjoy the awesome view of Rajbari and fascinating view of surrounding temple.

top_attractions.address: R7PJ+CC5, Chandra Mahal Road, Shakuntala Rd Ext, Palace Compound, Indranagar, Agartala, Tripura 799001, India

top_attractions.detail_description: Maharaja Bir Bikram College, also known as MBB College, was established in 1947 by Maharaja Bir Bikram with the goal of providing quality higher education to local youths. The campus, spanning 264 acres, is nestled amidst nature and features a picturesque lake. The college's architecture reflects the rich history of the royal Manikya dynasty.
top_attractions.excerpt: Maharaja Bir Bikram College, also known as MBB College, was established in 1947 by Maharaja Bir Bikram with the goal of providing quality higher education to local youths. The campus, spanning 264 acr
top_attractions.name: Maharaja Bir Bikram College

reviews.text: Maharaja Bir Bikram College¬†or¬†MBB College¬†is a degree college of the¬†Indian¬†state of¬†Tripura, imparting general education in the streams of Science, Commerce and Humanities. Established in 1947, it is the oldest college in the state of Tripura with a campus spread over 264 acres (107¬†ha).¬†It is located approximately 3¬†km (1.9¬†mi) from the city center. The motto of the college is "Vidayamrtamasnute" (Knowledge is the key to immortality). "Work Hard, Dream Big, Never Give Up"‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüíüüíüüíõüíõüíöüíöüß°üß°üß°ü§çü§çü§çüíöüíöüíö

Thee college eas built in 1947. The oldest building of the college is termed as 'heritage building' and recently got renovated.
The architecture of the college is stunning. It has a total of 4 academic buildings and one additional central Library. Though the library management is the worst, with limited books.
It has half build auditorium which was proposed in 2000's. Don't know why the work is pending till now.
Faculty is one of the best in the state.

The college management needs to focus on organising extra curricular activities, improving attendance rate and providing skill training to the students.

It is one of the oldest colleges of Tripura. Maharaja Bir Bikram Kishor Manikya Bahadur, the last illustrious king of Tripura was the architect and founder of this pioneering institution of higher learning in the state which was established in the year 1947. The sprawling college campus is spread over an area of 64 acres with lush green fields bordered with exotic varieties of trees and winding lakes haunted by migratory birds in winter. Maharaja Bir Bikram College or MBB College is a degree college of the Indian state of Tripura, imparting general education in the streams of Science, Commerce and Humanities. It is located approximately 3 km (1.9 mi) from the city center. The motto of the college is "Vidayamrtamasnute" (Knowledge is the key to immortality). The river Howrah flows along its southeast periphery and distant hill ranges form a bluish-green backdrop to the scenery. The sylvan landscape weaves a magic spell upon the visitor on his/her first encounter with the campus. Amidst these bounties of nature stands the imposing main college building, a fine specimen of Mughal architectural style designed by late Maharaja himself. On the whole, the college campus forms a major tourist attraction.

curation.llm_reason: Maharaja Bir Bikram College is an important educational institution with historical value but lacks broad tourist appeal or unique cultural significance as a visitor attraction in Agartala.

top_attractions.detail_description:
Ujjayanta Palace is a grand mansion built in the early 1900s, featuring a striking central dome and beautiful lakefront gardens. It houses the Tripura State Museum, which showcases the history, culture, and arts of Tripura and Northeast India. The palace is one of Agartala's top attractions, offering visitors a glimpse into the region's heritage through its well-curated galleries.

Lavish, early-1900s mansion with a vast central dome, lakefront gardens & Tripura State Museum.

"Step into the grandeur of Ujjayanta Palace, a stunning example of Tripura's rich history and architecture! Now a museum, it showcases the state's cultural heritage and royal legacy.

Visit and Explore:
1. Intricate architecture and beautiful gardens
2. Museum exhibits showcasing Tripura's history and culture
3. A glimpse into the royal past

#UjjayantaPalace #TripuraMuseum #HeritageTripura #RoyalLegacy #CulturalExperience

Plan your visit and discover the beauty of Ujjayanta Palace Museum!

Beautiful and famous Ujjayanta Palace at Agartala is the only Indo Saracenic Palace in NE India and is now a state museum with various exhibits, specially the Royal Gallery portraits are interesting. Light and sound show and musical fountain is available onsite between 6.30-7.30 pm. Tickets need to be purchased.

A very beautiful palace. Locals call it Rajbari !! It has a very serene view and a good museum attached within. The lakes on the side look so amazing.A must visit.Its just within the city, nice center location from most of the hotels.

This vibrant shopping complex offers a wide range of groceries and household products at reasonable prices. The ground floor is dedicated to kitchen essentials, while the upper level features an extensive selection of grocery items. Regular customers appreciate the warm and helpful staff who enhance the overall shopping experience.

top_attractions.name: Ghar Sansar

reviews.text: One of the reputed and popular Departmental store in Agartala. Ground floor you will get all the kitchen essentials and upstairs grocery items. I am regular customer here, stuffs are very warm welcoming and helpful.
Prices are reasonable but they need to upgrade their stocks and add other different household products, as the location is proper, than much people will come.
They don't accept credit card.in todays time i find it very amusing for a big shop like this to not accept credit card.a big disappointment.

curation.llm_reason: Ghar Sansar is a local grocery store without cultural significance or tourist appeal.

top_attractions.detail_description:
Unakoti Rock Carvings is an ancient worship site featuring intricate carved-rock sculptures set amidst a scenic natural backdrop. The massive relief sculptures of Hindu deities, some dating back to the 7th century, adorn rock faces throughout the site. Visitors can marvel at a variety of impressive carvings such as a towering 10m-tall sculpture of Shiva and a group of Ganeshas situated beside a waterfall. It takes approximately two hours to explore all noteworthy sights within the area.

Ancient worship site known for its carved-rock sculptures in a picturesque natural setting.
top_attractions.excerpt: Unakoti Rock Carvings is an ancient worship site featuring intricate carved-rock sculptures set amidst a scenic natural backdrop. The massive relief sculptures of Hindu deities, some dating back to th
top_attractions.name: Unakoti Rock Carvings

reviews.text:
It's a famous & popular tourist spot in the state. Better go there with your own vehicle/rented vehicle. Public transportation is available but up to the main road. From the main road, you have to walk 1-1.3km approx. to visit the destination. Or you can rent any e-rickshaw or auto, which are frequently available from Kumarghat railway station.

Nothing special to watch, just some ancient rock-carving sculptures, but the place is very peaceful, & I really love the place. But one important piece of advice to the ladies/girls: if you have not visited yet & are planning to visit the place, most importantly, if you are planning to explore the whole area, please don't wear heels/stilettos/block heels/platforms or wedges. Wear comfortable shoes or flats. It's tough to climb the high stairs. But visit at least once in your life; the place is really worth visiting.

Unakoti is a peaceful and beautiful place to visit. The ancient rock carvings are truly amazing, especially the huge Shiva face. The place feels very calm and full of natural beauty. It also has a small trekking path, which makes the visit more exciting.

The area is surrounded by greenery, and it's a great spot for those who enjoy nature and history together. The carvings are very old but still well-maintained. However, there are not many facilities, so it's better to carry your own water and snacks.

Overall, it's a nice place to visit with friends or family for a short trip. A must-see if you are in Tripura.

It's 4 hrs drive from Agartala, train takes about two and half hours, and the thing to see is just about 15-30 min.  The place is serene and located in the middle of jungle.  There are no shops, resturants, cabs around.  So be prepared in terms of transportation.
There's not much to do there, you'll be done in about 30 mins.... There's no point going there just for the spot from Agartala.... If you are visiting elsewhere and take a detour it's okay.  Travelling 8-10 hours for 30 min tour, you really have to decide whether it's worth or not.
All the rock carvings are at one side of a hill, at one sight you can see all that's  there.  Not a big place like Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu where the rock structures and carvings strech miles and miles.
The place is good no doubt but whether you want to take a drive of 8-10 hrs for a spot you'll cover within minutes is totally your call.

top_attractions.g_description: Ancient worship site known for its carved-rock sculptures in a picturesque natural setting.
top_attractions.address: Gakulnagar, Uttar Unakuti R.F., Tripura 799290, India

curation.llm_reason: Unakoti Rock Carvings is an important historical and cultural site near Agartala, featuring ancient Hindu sculptures with strong local significance and tourist appeal.

top_attractions.detail_description: The Fourteen Gods' and Goddesses' Temple in Agartala, Tripura, was constructed by King Krishna Manikya Deb Barma and is devoted to Chaturdasha Devta, fourteen Hindu deities. It holds great significance as the royal families of Tripura have been observing traditional worship practices at this site for generations. Situated 8 km from the city center, the temple attracts thousands of pilgrims and devotees during the annual Kharchi festival.
top_attractions.excerpt: The Fourteen Gods' and Goddesses' Temple in Agartala, Tripura, was constructed by King Krishna Manikya Deb Barma and is devoted to Chaturdasha Devta, fourteen Hindu deities. It holds great significanc
top_attractions.name: Fourteen Gods' and Goddesses' Temple

reviews.text: Thousands of people visit here during kharchi. Some are devotees & others visit here to enjoy the fair. From the main road we have to walk for 15-20 min to visit the main temple. If you are enochlophobic visit in early morning or kindly stay away.

Chaturdasha Temple is a Hindu temple in Agartala, Tripura, India, and features the Tripuri dome patterned after the roofs of village huts in Tripura. The dome is surmounted by a stupa-like structure which reveals traces of Buddhist influence. This temple was built in honour of fourteen deities, together called the Chaturdasha Devata.
Devotees visit the temple for the kharchi festival.
Old Agartala is 6km away from the present Capital City of Agartala where the Temple of fourteen Gods is located. Before 1770 A.D the images of Fourteen Gods were in Udaipur in two Temples beside Tripureswar Bhairab Temple. In 1770 A.D Maharaja Krishna Kishore Manikya being defeated by Shamsher Gaze, shifted his capital from Udaipur to Old Agartala and the images of Fourteen Gods were also taken to the capital and installed in a new Temple. Capital was once more shifted to the present Agartala in 1840 A.D. but the images of Fourteen Gods remained in the same Temple at Agartala.

On the occasion of the special puja of the Fourteen Gods known as ‚ÄòKharchi Puja', a grand mela or fair is held for 7 days in and around the Old palace. It is a popular religious shrine where thousands of devotees across the country assemble to celebrate Kharchi Festival with great pomp.

The worship of the Fourteen Gods has an old history and legend associated with it. During the time of Mahabharata, Trilochana, a contemporary of Yudhisthira, was the king of Tripura who used to worship these Fourteen Gods as Royal deities. The tradition continued with all the subsequent Kings of Tripura. Kharchi Puja observed during the month of Ashar (July) is very famous in Tripura. Animal sacrifices offered by the devotees are an integral feature of Kharchi puja. Inside the temple the images of Fourteen Gods do not consist of full body- only the images of heads of the Gods are there.

HAVELI MUSEUM: the additional for the tourist attraction at Old Agartala is a museum of living cultural heritage i. e. Haveli Museum.

According to traditions, the origin for the worship of these deities was contemporary to the setting of the Mahabharata, during the reign of Yudhishthira. They state that the god Shiva, after the death of Tripur (one of Tripura's legendary ancient kings), promised to grant a son and heir to his widow. However, the god stipulated that worship of the Chaturdasa Devata be duly and regularly observed in the kingdom in return. Historically, it is believed that the indigenous Tripuri people of Tripura had adjusted their native culture and religion with that of Hinduism when the latter's influence reached the region. The non-Brahman high priests, the Chantai, continued to minister their rites and rituals, but absorbed the important Hindu deities, resulting in their national pantheon transforming into the Chaturdasa Devata, with the deities being identified with a corresponding Brahmanical name.

Tripura, a state in Northeast India, is home to several ancient temples dedicated to various gods and goddesses. Here are 14 notable temples in Tripura:

1. _Tripureswari Temple_: Dedicated to Goddess Tripureswari (Kali)
2. _Bhuvaneswari Temple_: Dedicated to Goddess Bhuvaneswari (Durga)
3. _Durga Bari Temple_: Dedicated to Goddess Durga
4. _Lakshmi Narayan Temple_: Dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi
5. _Chaturdasha Temple_: Dedicated to 14 deities, including Shiva, Vishnu, and Durga
6. _Bishnu Mandir_: Dedicated to Lord Vishnu
7. _Kali Bari Temple_: Dedicated to Goddess Kali
8. _Krishna Mandir_: Dedicated to Lord Krishna
9. _Rama Krishna Mandir_: Dedicated to Lord Rama and Krishna
10. _Siva Mandir_: Dedicated to Lord Shiva
11. _Jagannath Mandir_: Dedicated to Lord Jagannath (Krishna)
12. _Ganesha Mandir_: Dedicated to Lord Ganesha
13. _Kali Mandir_: Dedicated to Goddess Kali
14. _Mahadeva Mandir_: Dedicated to Lord Shiva

These temples showcase the rich cultural heritage and spiritual significance of Tripura, reflecting the state's history and architectural styles.

Tripura University, located in Suryamaninagar, Agartala, is a central university offering higher education in a peaceful and scenic environment. The campus is well-maintained, with clean grounds and a serene atmosphere that supports academic focus. Students generally appreciate the disciplined environment and the efforts taken to maintain hygiene across hostels, classrooms, and common areas.
The university has a competent faculty, many of whom are experienced and approachable. Its library is well-stocked with academic resources, and students find the canteen and basic amenities satisfactory. The campus also includes separate hostel facilities, sports grounds, and academic blocks, making it a well-rounded institution for higher learning.
However, some challenges have been noted. Administrative issues have occasionally caused concern among students, with reports of nepotism and inefficiency sparking protests in the past. Infrastructure in certain areas requires further improvement to meet modern standards, though overall, the university continues to function effectively.
Tripura University has steadily improved its ranking but still faces competition from other central universities in terms of research output and facilities. Despite these challenges, the academic environment and dedicated faculty make it a favorable choice for students seeking higher education in Tripura.
Overall, Tripura University provides a supportive and focused learning atmosphere. While administrative and infrastructure improvements are necessary, the university's strengths in faculty, discipline, and campus environment make it a respectable institution for students from Tripura and neighboring states.

top_attractions.detail_description:
The Jagannath Bari is an octagonal Hindu temple located at the Ujjayanta Palace that was constructed during the 19th century. This four-story building is a testament to the architectural brilliance of its time, featuring intricate designs and exceptional craftsmanship. The temple remains an important landmark in the region and continues to attract visitors from all over the world.

top_attractions.detail_description:
Sipahijala Wildlife Sanctuary is a zoological park that houses a variety of animals, including lions, bears, and deer. The sanctuary features a scenic lake where visitors can go boating. It is recommended to bring water bottles and a camera for optimal enjoyment. Notable wildlife attractions include Hulok Gibbon, Rock Python, Hippocampus, and clouded leopards. This national park in Tripura offers an excellent opportunity for exploring wildlife in the region.

Lions, bear & deer are among the many animals in this zoological park with a lake for boating.

top_attractions.name: Sepahijala Wildlife Sanctuary & Zoo

reviews.text:
Sepahijala Wildlife Sanctuary is a gem in the heart of Tripura, offering a peaceful escape into the wild. Whether you're an avid wildlife enthusiast, a nature lover or someone looking for a tranquil retreat, this sanctuary promises a memorable experience. Its rich biodiversity, coupled with a serene environment, makes Sepahijala a must-visit destination for anyone visiting Tripura of India.
Spread over an area of approximately 18.53 square kilometers, this sanctuary offers a unique blend of flora and fauna amidst lush greenery and serene landscapes.
Sepahijala is renowned for its diverse array of wildlife, including several endangered species. The sanctuary is home to the famous Phayre's leaf langur or spectacles monkeys (‡¶ö‡¶∂‡¶Æ‡¶æ ‡¶¨‡¶æ‡¶®‡¶∞), a primate species with striking features and expressive eyes. Visitors can also spot other mammals like the clouded leopard, jungle fowl and various species of deer. Birdwatchers will delight in the rich avian diversity, with over 150 species of birds, including the white-winged wood duck.
The sanctuary is not just about wildlife; it also boasts an impressive collection of botanical wonders. The dense forests are interspersed with rare and plants, making it a fascinating spot for botanists and nature lovers alike.
Adjacent to the sanctuary (different entrance) is a scenic lake with sprawling gardens providing a perfect backdrop for photography and relaxation. One can pass a few hours doing boating and photography of aquatic birds there.
Sepahijala Wildlife Sanctuary offers several attractions, including a zoo and a botanical garden. The zoo is well-maintained and provides an opportunity to observe animals in a more controlled environment.
On the other side of the sanctuary, there is a spot for picnic.
The entry ticket of the sanctuary costs ‚Çπ20/- per person and ‚Çπ50/- per light vehicle. The entry ticket in the zoo costs ‚Çπ25 per person (as of February 2025).
The sanctuary is easily accessible from the nearby city of Agartala, making it a convenient day trip. The roads leading to the sanctuary are well-maintained and there are basic amenities available for visitors. However, it is advisable to carry your own refreshments and essentials if planning a longer visit as there is no food stall available inside. Avoid throwing plastic and littering inside the zoo.
A great place to spend a day. Log hut is less expensive and great. Zoo is beautiful.

Today, I visited Sepahijala Park, and overall, it was a pleasant experience. The journey itself was enjoyable, and the park is situated in a lovely location, making it easily accessible and visually appealing. Upon arriving, I noticed that the traffic quality around the park was moderate, which made the commute manageable without much hassle. The staff at the park were well-behaved, polite, and helpful, contributing positively to the overall experience.

The park's layout and surroundings were quite impressive. It is clear that a lot of thought has gone into its design and maintenance. The natural beauty of the location adds to its charm, creating a serene and welcoming atmosphere for visitors. The park is a great place for families, friends, or individuals looking to spend some quality time amidst nature.

However, one aspect of the park that stood out, albeit not in a positive way, was the way the animals were housed. All the animals were kept in cages, which gave the park an unappealing and somewhat outdated look. While it is understandable that cages are often necessary for the safety of both the animals and visitors, the overall aesthetic of the park suffered as a result. The sight of the animals in confined spaces was somewhat disheartening, as it did not reflect the natural habitats they deserve. This aspect of the park could definitely be improved by adopting more modern and humane enclosure designs that mimic natural habitats. Doing so would not only enhance the park's appearance but also improve the quality of life for the animals.

Despite this shortcoming, my visit to Sepahijala Park was a delightful experience. The park offers an excellent opportunity to reconnect with nature and observe various animals up close, which can be especially educational for children. The moderate traffic, courteous staff, and beautiful location added to the overall appeal, making the visit worthwhile.

In conclusion, while there is room for improvement, particularly in the way the animals are housed, Shepahijala Park remains a lovely destination for a day out. I hope the park authorities will consider updating the enclosures to create a more aesthetically pleasing and animal-friendly environment. Such improvements would undoubtedly elevate the park's status and make it an even more enjoyable place to visit in the future.

top_attractions.detail_description: At the ISKCON Agartala Hindu temple, one can enjoy a delicious and affordable 20 rupee tiffin for breakfast consisting of puri sabzi. The temple hosts various events, including last rites and weddings performed under ISKCON norms. These ceremonies are simple yet charming, with delectable food such as fried rice, pakoda made from Banana blossom, baby corn and paneer sabzi, daal, another paneer dish, chutney, and vanilla ice cream.
